issue.title: Debian packages for Gazebo 3.0 and ROS gazebo packages

content.raw:
Let me clarify that if you want to use gazebo from default (will be 3.0), you don't need to compile the whole ROS from source. What you will need to compile is all packages in ROS that depends on gazebo (like ros-$distro-gazebo-pkgs). And catkin is a really really nice tool to do this in a very easy way. So summarizing:

* Install ROS base system from debs with gazebo related packages (as usual)
* Install your favorites physics engines
* Compile gazebo from source and install into the system
* Create a catkin workspace, add ros-$distro-gazebo-pkgs repository and all other repositories build on top of gazebo.

Feel free to contact me if you need any help.
